name: limestone quarry operation | limestone, unprocessed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11109/documentation

This dataset represents the extraction of unprocessed limestone from a quarry in Quebec.;;Diesel and explosive consumption, and emissions to air provided by three (3) important limestone extraction sites was used. CO, SO2 and NOx emissions reported by the company were excluded from the dataset, since related to diesel and explosive combustion (and included in the "diesel,  burned in building machine" and  "blasting" datasets). Similarly, particulates emissions  related to diesel and explosive combustion were substracted from the air emissions reported by the company, to avoid double counting.;;Land occupation, land transformation, land-use for recultivation were estimated from a weighted average of three Quebec limestone quarries extracting 990'000, 88'000 and 480'000 tons of limestone per year (780'000 tons average), and an estimated lifetime of the deposits of 140 years.;;Water use, quarry infrastructure and office heating has been included, based on "limestone quarry operation, GLO 2002" ecoinvent dataset.

From the calcite, in ground

This activity ends with the unprocessed limestone, at the quarry gate.

This dataset includes blasting, all transports within the quarry (for extraction and recultivation), a part of the heating energy for "administration" buildings and the infrastructure. The land-use of the quarry is included, the land-use of the paved roads and buildings within the quarry are included in the module "limestone quarry construction".
 
The dataset doesn't include output of overburden material: neglected as it is only about 0.26% of mined limestone.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Quebec data are from the only comany that extracts limestone on the territory. Unavalable data were extrapolated based on the GLO dataset exchanges.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Building machines operates with diesel. Extrapolation: In Quebec, 65% of the extraction is made using Ammonia explosive, and 35% using gelatin explosive. The tovex explosive was used as a proxy in this module. CO, SO2 and NOx emissions reported by the company were excluded from the dataset, since related to diesel and explosive combustion (and included in the "diesel,  burned in building machine" and  "blasting" datasets).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
A weighted average of three limestone quarries in Quebec was used.
When no information available, GLO exchanges have been used as proxy for Quebec. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
See Geography and Technolgy fields for details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The only limstone producer in Quebec provided information regarding its quarry operations.
